resources.string: From fancy steaks to a nice bowl of pho, Search for the best restaurants Saskatoon has to offer!
Looking for a nice workout? Trainers and chain gyms, Saskatoon has everything you need for your workout needs.
Want to sip coffee at a nice patio? More into chic new interiors? Just want good coffee? Saskatoon has it all!
Family fun and more! Look for some great spots in Saskatoon to spend time with the kids!
Saskatoon is home to some of the best parks in the province. Home to many great natural sceneries thanks to its rivers.
From huge shopping malls to a quaint farmer\'s market, here are Saskatoon\'s best.

A great gym that offers multiple programs with a professional and friendly staff. Has multiple zones that allow you to have all your equipment in one spot.\n Offers physiotherapy and post injury rehab.
Community-focused nonprofit established in 1844 with recreational programs & services for all ages. Has plenty of facilities such as a pool and a weight room.\n Kid friendly

A real classic old school gym. A spacious gym with a wide selection of free weights, Olympic lifting platforms, powerlifting platforms, mono-lift, competition bench and a cardio area.\n Comes with chalk
A humble no contract gym that\'s been around since 2002. This gym has a lot of equipment and is very welcoming, a place to really focus on your workouts.
3110 Clarence Ave S, Saskatoon, SK S7T 0C9/ 153 Gibson Bnd, Saskatoon, SK S7V 0P1/ 134 Primrose Dr, Saskatoon, SK S7K 5S6/ 320 Shillington Cres, Saskatoon, SK S7M 1L2
A chain gym with all your fitness needs. Since it has multiple locations it\'s perfect for a quick workout on the go.\n One membership is good for all locations.
A great place to get all you can eat sushi! With a great selection of nigiris, rolls, and tempura this place has it all.\n Make sure to order 20 shrimp tempuras!
Modern restaurant fixing up Brooklyn-style pies in a hip space with murals, booths & a cocktail bar. Perfect for a pizza during the night out.\n The Friday is a great pizza with spice.
1806 Idylwyld Dr N, Saskatoon, SK S7L 1B5
A nice vietnamese restaurant located in a gas station. Don\'t let the setting fool you, this place serves amazing vietnamese food at a cheap price.\n Has a kid friendly menu.
Contemporary venue offering steaks, chops & seafood & a basement lounge for drinks & casual dining.
Colourful hangout with a tropical vibe serving eclectic Pan-Latin & Caribbean fare, plus drinks.
Cozy, family-owned cafe pouring rotating single origin coffees, with baked goods & sandwiches.
Nice bright clean family run coffee shop located at 2nd ave.\n Offers a variety of fresh food.
An authentic local bakery that sells coffee in 33rd. The coffee is great but the sandwiches are the real highlight of this location.\n They sell delicious pastries and breads as well
Excellent spot for singularly sourced coffee. An old space with a lot of character.\n Offers 5G internet.
339 Ave A S, Saskatoon, SK S7M 1L7
A modern daytime cafe that offers classic cafe dishes in a stylish, airy interior.\n Offers excellent patio seating
500 Spadina Crescent E, Saskatoon, SK S7K 3G8
Nice area to walk, bike, run, boat, or sit and enjoy the day.\n Make sure to visit taste of Saskatchewan held here every year for good eats!
2703 Spadina Crescent E, Saskatoon, SK S7K 6P7
Natural parkland offering hiking trails, sculptures, grassy areas & picnic facilities by the river.
meets Spadina Cres, Avenue F S, Saskatoon, SK
A nice large spacious park right beside the river. Has benches, climbing structure, saucer swings, and a nearby barbecue area.\n Great for dogs.
Northeast of Silverwood Golf Course and south along river, Kinnear Ave, Saskatoon, SK S7P 0B7
Large dog park right beside of Silverwood Golf Course. Lots of great natural trails and a place you can off leash.\n Even has water fountains for dogs.
1903 Forestry Farm Park Dr, Saskatoon, SK S7S 1G9

The Forestry Farm Park and Zoo is a forested park and zoo located in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada. The park was originally established as the Dominion Forest Nursery Station and later Sutherland Forest Nursery Station.\n Kid friendly.

A fun park with lots of trampoline for some jumping fun! Staff is good cooperative. A good place to spend family quality time far from the hustle bustle of life. Different variety of jumping activities for kids and older as well.\n Kid friendly.
945 Spadina Crescent E, Saskatoon, SK S7K 3H6

Celebrate the magic of play at this fine Saskatoon attraction. Ride the vintage carousel and the Canpotex Train, soar high on the ferris wheel or run free in the water, sand and natural play area. Let moments become memories in the heart of Saskatoon.

The Western Development Museum is the keeper of Saskatchewan’s collective heritage. The Museum shares the province’s unique sense of place with all people for their understanding and enjoyment – recognizing that the legacy of the past is the foundation for a sustainable future.
Box 255 RR#6 LCD Main, Saskatoon, SK S7K 3J9

Exploring Saskatoon from the South Saskatchewan River is like discovering the city all over again. Join us on The Prairie Lily for one of our many cruises through the Meewasin Valley and take in the beauty of our living river, our friendly city, and our expansive prairie sky.
Spacious, updated shopping mall with fashion, cosmetics & phone stores & a popular food hall.

The Centre is a major shopping mall located south-east of the junction of Circle Drive and 8th Street in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan in the Wildwood neighbourhood.\n Be sure to check out Rainbow Cinemas located in this mall.

Lawson Heights Mall is a shopping centre located at the junction of Warman Road and Primrose Drive in north Saskatoon, Saskatchewan in the Lawson Heights Suburban Centre neighbourhood. It is currently anchored by Canada Safeway and London Drugs, and has almost 100 shops and services.
Preston Ave N, Saskatoon, SK S7N 4V2
This little strip mall has a many places to eat and places to get groceries and your everyday Necessities.\n Easy parking.
The Saskatoon Farmers\' Market is a profit, vendor-owned cooperative that operates year-round, twice-weekly Farmers\' market in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada.
